speaker: Medic
lines: Canvas smells of herbs and arguments won late.
A cot sags with the memory of someone else's pain.
'Sit,' the medic says, and you do, because the verb is practiced.
They bind your wrist with linen that once was a shirt worth keeping.
A jar of tincture winks; it knows hurt when it sees it.
'You don't have to be brave. Just be here.'
The bell asks a question; your ribs answer honestly.
You leave with new lines drawn where you need them.
